subject: Real Estate
title: The Minsky Moment in Real Estate
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Minsky Moment in Real Estate.

hook.text: Hyman Minsky argued that stability itself breeds instability. Long calm periods create dangerous risk-taking.

buildup.text: In stable markets, lenders relax standards. Borrowers take on more debt. Everyone assumes the good times last.

discovery.text: Minsky identified three borrower types: hedge, speculative, and Ponzi â€” each riskier than the last.

twist.text: By the time Ponzi borrowers dominate â€” those who can only pay if prices keep rising â€” the crash is near.

climax.text: The 2008 crisis was a textbook Minsky moment. Stability had bred the very risk that destroyed it.

punchline.text: Calm markets are the most dangerous.

quiz.question: What did Minsky argue about financial stability?
options: It breeds instability by encouraging risk
